Inventory Associate Job at ipNX Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        ipNX is one of Nigeria’s fastest growing Information and Communications Technology companies, serving a multitude of needs across enterprises, small businesses and residents with innovative, world-class services.

Our ability to identify, satisfy and exceed today’s market needs is a testament to over a decade of experience, our commitment, drive and passion realized through highly skilled and well seasoned professionals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Associate

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To provide support for all Inventory management activities in the region to all departments in order to achieve their operational targets.


Responsibilities


	Implement the company’s policies and guidelines with regards to Inventory management process while supporting regional operations’ needs
	Ensure completeness in all deliveries to the region with real time documentation of same.
	Coordinate all daily requisitions from user departments following the guidelines in fulfilling the orders received through PARIC.
	Liaise with the Head for stock replenishment based on the material requirement plan for the region.
	Document all daily transactions, post same on SUN Application.
	Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly and yearly Inventory management report.
	Perform cyclic stock checks and quarterly Stock count for proper stock accountability for the region.
	Coordinate the end of year stock count for the region.
	Prepare and send to Headquarter a list of faulty equipment for repair and liaise with Headquarter for directive on same, on a quarterly basis.


Qualifications / Experience


	B.Sc. / HND in Social or Management Sciences or related field.
	Minimum of 2 years in inventory Management.
	Documentation skills.
	Inventory Management skills.
	Professional Qualification in Supply Management (added advantage).
	Basic understanding of Inventory Management.


Salary
N105,000 / Month.

Note: Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Grants & Proposal Development Associate Job at Rise Networks




        
    

        
        Rise Networks is Nigeria’s pioneering AI for Development (AI4D) organization, building Africa’s next generation of ethical AI talent and innovators. Through research, training, advisory, and policy engagement, we equip individuals and organizations with future – ready skills that bridge learning and employment. Our work advances Tech Justice and Digital Rights, promotes inclusive digital literacy, and drives policy influence and community transformation. By doing so, Rise Networks positions Africa as a co-creator in the global AI ecosystem, shaping an ethical, innovation-driven future.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Grants & Proposal Development Associate
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time, On-site

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Grants & Proposal Development Associate to join our dynamic team.
	The ideal candidate will support the end-to-end grants management process, from identifying funding opportunities and preparing compelling proposals to monitoring project deliverables and ensuring compliance with donor requirements.
	This role requires excellent writing skills, strong financial and analytical acumen, and the ability to coordinate multiple projects in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Research and identify new grant and partnership opportunities from foundations, corporations, and development organizations.
	Prepare, review, and submit high-quality grant proposals, concept notes, and reports.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date grant tracking systems, including deadlines and deliverables.
	Support budget preparation and ensure alignment with project objectives and compliance standards.
	Collaborate with program, finance, and communications teams to gather relevant data and impact metrics.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with current and potential donors.
	Monitor active grants, ensuring timely reporting, evaluation, and renewal processes.
	Contribute to the development of strategic fundraising plans and institutional proposals.


Qualifications and Skills


	2–4 years of proven experience in grant writing, fundraising, or donor relations [preferably in a non-profit or development organization].
	Exceptional writing, editing, and research skills.
	Strong understanding of proposal development, budgeting, and reporting standards.
	High level of accuracy, organization, and attention to detail.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and familiarity with CRM or grant management tools.
	Commitment to Rise Networks’ mission of advancing inclusive digital literacy and ethical AI innovation in Africa.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should please send their authentic, brief but concise CV to: people@risenetworks.org using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	Only qualified Candidates will be contacted.
	Thank you very much & Best Wishes.
